Name: [Computer Science Unplugged](http://csunplugged.org/)
Description: A set of resources for teaching Computer Science concepts without using a computer (referred to as "unplugged" methods of teaching).

Name: [TryComputing Inspire Lessons](http://www.trycomputing.org/inspire)
Description: A collection of lesson plans, that were created as part of the [TryComputing](http://www.trycomputing.org/) project.

Name: [Google CS First](https://www.cs-first.com/)
Description: A website that provides video tutorials for learning Coding with [Scratch](https://scratch.mit.edu/). The tutorials are created with particular themes (for example: Sports and Arts), as a way to appeal to different students' interests and hobbies.

Name: [Code Club Resources](http://projects.codeclubworld.org/en-GB/)
Description: Code Club is a non-profit organisation that organises after-school Coding clubs for primary school students. The website has resources for a variety of languages (such as [Scratch](https://scratch.mit.edu/) and [Python](https://www.python.org/)) that registered Code Clubs can use to learn Coding.
